TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWithPorts`1<ParentT> implements class Microsoft.Azure.Management.ResourceManager.Fluent.Core.IBeta
Public Interface IWithPorts(Of ParentT) Implements IBeta

Docs.typeparam: The stage of the parent definition to return to after attaching this definition.
Docs.summary: The stage of the container instance definition allowing to specify the container ports.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Azure.Management.ContainerInstance.Fluent.ContainerGroup.Definition.IWithPortsOrContainerInstanceAttach<ParentT> WithExternalTcpPort (int port);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.ContainerInstance.Fluent.ContainerGroup.Definition.IWithPortsOrContainerInstanceAttach`1<!ParentT> WithExternalTcpPort(int32 port) cil managed
Public Function WithExternalTcpPort (port As Integer) As IWithPortsOrContainerInstanceAttach(Of ParentT)
abstract member WithExternalTcpPort : int -> Microsoft.Azure.Management.ContainerInstance.Fluent.ContainerGroup.Definition.IWithPortsOrContainerInstanceAttach<'ParentT>

Docs.param: TCP port to be exposed externally.
Docs.summary: Specifies the container's TCP port available to external clients. A public IP address will be create to allow external clients to reach the containers within the group. To enable external clients to reach a container within the group, you must expose the port on the IP address and from the container. Because containers within the group share a port namespace, port mapping is not supported.
Docs.return: The next stage of the definition.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Azure.Management.ContainerInstance.Fluent.ContainerGroup.Definition.IWithPortsOrContainerInstanceAttach<ParentT> WithInternalTcpPort (int port);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.ContainerInstance.Fluent.ContainerGroup.Definition.IWithPortsOrContainerInstanceAttach`1<!ParentT> WithInternalTcpPort(int32 port) cil managed

abstract member WithInternalTcpPort : int -> Microsoft.Azure.Management.ContainerInstance.Fluent.ContainerGroup.Definition.IWithPortsOrContainerInstanceAttach<'ParentT>

Docs.param: TCP port to be exposed internally.
Docs.summary: Specifies the container's TCP port is available to internal clients only (other container instances within the container group). Containers within a group can reach each other via localhost on the ports that they have exposed, even if those ports are not exposed externally on the group's IP address.
Docs.return: The next stage of the definition.
